# swarm — Multi-agent orchestration for Claude Code

> Plugin for Claude Code that coordinates teams of agents with shared tasks, inter-agent messaging, and 7 proven orchestration patterns.

## Overview

swarm is a Claude Code plugin that enables multi-agent orchestration. It provides:
- Team creation and lifecycle management
- Shared task lists with dependencies
- Inter-agent messaging (direct, broadcast, protocol)
- 7 orchestration patterns: Parallel Specialists, Pipeline, Swarm, Research+Implementation, Plan Approval, Multi-File Refactoring, RLM
- RLM (Recursive Language Model) pattern for large-file analysis with content-aware chunking

## Documentation

- Getting Started: /claude-team-orchestration/getting-started/getting-started/
- Orchestration Patterns: /claude-team-orchestration/how-to/patterns/
- RLM Examples: /claude-team-orchestration/how-to/rlm-examples/
- Agent Types: /claude-team-orchestration/reference/agent-types/
- Reference: /claude-team-orchestration/reference/reference/
- Concepts: /claude-team-orchestration/concepts/concepts/

## Skills

- orchestrating — Entry point for multi-agent orchestration
- team-management — Create, configure, and manage agent teams
- task-system — Shared task lists with dependencies
- messaging — Inter-agent communication
- agent-types — Agent selection guide
- orchestration-patterns — 7 proven coordination patterns
- rlm-pattern — Large-file analysis with content-aware chunking
- jsonl-log-analyzer — Schema-aware JSONL log analysis
- spawn-backends — Agent display modes (in-process, tmux, iTerm2)
- error-handling — Debug and recovery strategies
